title: malariasimulation post-processing
text: Use postie post-process malariasimulation model output. Postie requires conventions work: age-bands clinical severe incidence must . practice means need set, example: ft (treatment coverage) output variable. likely result setting treatment simulation, example: alternatively, treatment implemented, just add ft = 0 simulation output using postie.
code: year <- 365 min_ages <- year * 0:99 max_ages <- year * 1:100 parameters$clinical_incidence_rendering_min_ages = min_ages parameters$clinical_incidence_rendering_max_ages = max_ages parameters$severe_incidence_rendering_min_ages = min_ages parameters$severe_incidence_rendering_max_ages = max_ages parameters |> malariasimulation::set_drugs(list(malariasimulation::AL_params)) |> malariasimulation::set_clinical_treatment(1, 50, 0.5)

title: Disability adjusted life years — dalys
text: Calculate Years Lived Disability (YLDs) Disability-Adjusted Life-Years based disability weights Global Burden Disease study. estimate YLL assume average life expectancy person aged x years taken UN WPP Africa profile 2022. estimate expected age given range assume exponentially distributed ages range. YLLs calculated multiplying deaths number years individual expected live past year death.

title: Disability adjusted life years — dalys
code: dalys(   x,   ages_as_years,   life_expectancy,   mild_disability_weight = 0.006,   moderate_disability_weight = 0.051,   severe_disability_weight = 0.133,   clinical_episode_length = 0.01375,   severe_episode_length = 0.04795 )

title: Disability adjusted life years — dalys
text: x Input data.frame ages_as_years Convert ages units years life_expectancy data.frame expected years left live. See example data format mild_disability_weight disability weight mild malaria. Assigned clinical cases 5 years old moderate_disability_weight disability weight moderate malaria. Assigned clinical cases 5 years old severe_disability_weight disability weight severe malaria. Assigned severe cases clinical_episode_length average length episode clinical malaria severe_episode_length average length episode severe malaria

title: Disability adjusted life years — dalys
text: Disability weights sourced Duration disease sourced Winskill et al 2017 (Supplementary Table 8) approximation YLD estimation GBD study; disability due comorbid conditions motor impairment anemia excluded. Note: weights lengths currently Plasmodium falciparum.

what: Extract basic rates from malariasimulation model output — get_rates
title: Extract basic rates from malariasimulation model output — get_rates
text: Summarises clinical incidence `clinical`, severe incidence `severe` mortality `mortality` rates well per-capita years lived disability `yld`, years life lost `yll` daly `dalys`. rates expressed per person per day.

title: Extract basic rates from malariasimulation model output — get_rates
code: get_rates(   x,   baseline_year = 2000,   ages_as_years = TRUE,   scaler = 0.215,   treatment_scaler = 0.42,   mild_disability_weight = 0.006,   moderate_disability_weight = 0.051,   severe_disability_weight = 0.133,   clinical_episode_length = 0.01375,   severe_episode_length = 0.04795,   life_expectancy = life_expectancy_africa,   infer_ft = TRUE )

title: Extract basic rates from malariasimulation model output — get_rates
text: x Input data.frame baseline_year Baseline year (assumes simulation starts first day year) ages_as_years Convert ages units years scaler Scaler severe cases deaths. original fitted scaler P. falciparum 0.215. See Griffin et al (2016). treatment_scaler impact treatment coverage progression severe disease death. probability hospitalised untreated cases compared treated cases difficult study known, can estimated available data several assumptions. estimate derived data used meta-analysis impact delayed treatment uncomplicated malaria progression severe malaria (Mousa et al, 2020, Plos Medicine), estimated relative risk ratio treatment delays 1-2, 2-3 >3 days compared treatment within 1 day. , assume risk hospitalisation severe malaria among untreated cases double risk last “delay category” >3 days (2 * RR 1.186), giving relative risk severe malaria 0.578 treatment within 1 day compared treatment (.e. treatment scaler 0.42 proportion severe malaria cases prevented treatment uncomplicated malaria). However, sensitivity analysis range 0.281-0.843 considered treatment scaler, derived assuming risk among untreated cases risk treatment delay >3 days (lower estimate) 3 times risk treatment delay >3 days (upper estimate). mild_disability_weight disability weight mild malaria. Assigned clinical cases 5 years old moderate_disability_weight disability weight moderate malaria. Assigned clinical cases 5 years old severe_disability_weight disability weight severe malaria. Assigned severe cases clinical_episode_length average length episode clinical malaria severe_episode_length average length episode severe malaria life_expectancy data.frame expected years left live. See example data format infer_ft ft found model output (usually ft = 0), assume ft = 0. FALSE error thrown

Disability weights sourced:  . approximation YLD estimation GBD study; disability due comorbid conditions motor impairment aneamia excluded. Note: Default parameter values _Plasmodium falciparum_

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: page lists tidy eval tools reexported package rlang. learn using tidy eval scripts packages high level, see dplyr programming vignette ggplot2 packages vignette. Metaprogramming section Advanced R may also useful deeper dive. tidy eval operators {{, !!, !!! syntactic constructs specially interpreted tidy eval functions. mostly need {{, !! !!! advanced operators use simple cases. curly-curly operator {{ allows tunnel data-variables passed function arguments inside tidy eval functions. {{ designed individual arguments. pass multiple arguments contained dots, use ... normal way.   enquo() enquos() delay execution one several function arguments. former returns single expression, latter returns list expressions. defused, expressions longer evaluate . must injected back evaluation context !! (single expression) !!! (list expressions).   simple case, code equivalent usage {{ ... . Defusing enquo() enquos() needed complex cases, instance need inspect modify expressions way. .data pronoun object represents current slice data. variable name string, use .data pronoun subset variable [[.   Another tidy eval operator :=. makes possible use glue curly-curly syntax LHS =. technical reasons, R language support complex expressions left =, use := workaround.   Many tidy eval functions like dplyr::mutate() dplyr::summarise() give automatic name unnamed inputs. need create sort automatic names , use as_label(). instance, glue-tunnelling syntax can reproduced manually :   Expressions defused enquo() (tunnelled {{) need simple column names, can arbitrarily complex. as_label() handles cases gracefully. code assumes simple column name, use as_name() instead. safer throws error input name expected.
code: my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {   data %>%     group_by(...) %>%     summarise(mean = mean({{ var }})) } my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {   # Defuse   var <- enquo(var)   dots <- enquos(...)    # Inject   data %>%     group_by(!!!dots) %>%     summarise(mean = mean(!!var)) } my_var <- "disp" mtcars %>% summarise(mean = mean(.data[[my_var]])) my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {   # Use `{{` to tunnel function arguments and the usual glue   # operator `{` to interpolate plain strings.   data %>%     summarise("{{ var }}_mean_{suffix}" := mean({{ var }})) } my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {   var <- enquo(var)   prefix <- as_label(var)   data %>%     summarise("{prefix}_mean_{suffix}" := mean(!!var)) }
